conclusion: The board never moves, so the horizontal forces acting on the board must balance at every instant.
The only horizontal forces on the board are the kinetic-friction force F₁ exerted by the ground and the kinetic-friction force F₂ exerted on the board by the sliding block.
The kinetic-friction force F₁ exerted by the ground has a magnitude of μ₁(M+m)g and acts opposite to any tendency of motion of the board.
The kinetic-friction force F₂ exerted on the board by the sliding block has a magnitude of μ₂ m g and is exerted in the direction opposite to the block’s motion.
For the board to remain at rest, the forces F₁ and F₂ must cancel each other, so F₁ = F₂.
Equating the forces gives μ₁(M+m)g = μ₂ m g.
The magnitude of the frictional force that the ground exerts on the board is Fground = μ₂ m g.
